meanings.definition: The act of dividing or classifying into two mutually exclusive categories.
meanings.sent1: The dichotomization of animals into herbivores and carnivores helps us understand their diets.
meanings.sent2: In science class, we learned about the dichotomization of plants into flowering and non-flowering.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomization of socks into clean and dirty piles made doing laundry more fun.
meanings.sent4: Her dichotomization of people into good and bad was too simplistic for the real world.
meanings.sent5: The dichotomization of colors into warm and cool tones is essential for artists.

meanings.definition: The process of creating a binary distinction or division.
meanings.sent1: The dichotomization of tasks into urgent and non-urgent helps prioritize work.
meanings.sent2: During the debate, the politician used dichotomization to simplify complex issues.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomization of desserts into chocolate and vanilla made choosing easier.
meanings.sent4: His dichotomization of music into good and bad genres limited his appreciation.
meanings.sent5: The dichotomization of books into fiction and non-fiction guides library organization.
